Check if in given vector of numbers, are any two numbers closer to each other than
given threshold.
>>> had_closest_elements({1.0, 2.0, 3.0}, 0.5)
false
>>> had_closest_elements({1.0, 2.8, 3.0, 4.0, 5.0, 2.0}, 0.3)
true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
bool had_closest_elements(vector<float> numbers, float threshold){
    float diff;
    vector<float> temp;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        diff = abs(numbers[i] - threshold);
        temp.push_back(numbers[i]);
    }
    sort(temp.begin(), temp.end());
    for(int i = 0; i < temp.size(); i++){
        if(temp[i]!= numbers[i]){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

Given a vector of integers, sort the integers that are between 1 and 9 inclusive,
reverse the resulting vector, and then replace each digit by its corresponding name from
"One", "Two", "Three", "Four", "Five", "Six", "Seven", "Eight", "Nine".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  arr = {}
  return {}

    }
    return res;
}

>>> special_factorial(4)

*/

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for integers
>>> filter_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
#include<list>
typedef std::list<boost::any> list_any;
using namespace std;
vector<int> filter_integers(list_any values){
    vector<int> result;
    for(list_any v: values){
        if(boost::any_cast<int>(v)){
            result.push_back(v);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double zero=0;
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
        if (sum==0)
        {
            zero=xs[i];
            break;
        }
    }
    return zero;
}

    /*

    Moreover, find_one only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.

    double one=0;

    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);

        }
    }
    return one;
}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> unique(vector<int> l){
    sort(l.begin(), l.end());
    vector<int> u;
    for(int i = 1; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i]!= l[i - 1]){
            u.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return u;
}

    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){

            l1.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return l1;
}

3
>>> median({-10, 4, 6, 1000, 10, 20})

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
float median(vector<float> l){
    float m = 0, n = 0, sum = 0, i;
    for(i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        sum += l[i];
    }
    for(i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        n += l[i];
    }
    n /= 2;
    for(i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        m += l[i] * (l[i] - sum) / n;
    }
    return m;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return 2^n modulo p (be aware of numerics).
>>> modp(3, 5)
3
>>> modp(1101, 101)
2
>>> modp(0, 101)
1
>>> modp(3, 11)
8

1
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
int modp(int n,int p){
    int t,i;
    t=n%p;
    i=p-1;
    while(t){
        t=t/p;
        i--;
    }
    return i;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
brackets is a string of '<' and '>'.
return true if every opening bracket has a corresponding closing bracket.

>>> correct_bracketing("<")
false
>>> correct_bracketing("<>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("<<><>>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("><<>")
false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool correct_bracketing(string brackets){
    for(int i=0;i<brackets.size();i++){
        if(brackets[i]=='<'){
            if(brackets[i+1]=='<'){
                return false;
            }
        }
        if(brackets[i]=='>'){
            if(brackets[i+1]=='>'){
                return false;
            }
        }
    }
    return true;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
and return the result as a string.
If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
>>> circular_shift(12, 1)
"21"
>>> circular_shift(12, 2)
"12"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string circular_shift(int x,int shift){
    string res;
    while(x>0){
        res.push_back(x%10);
        x=x/10;
    }
    res.reverse();
    for(int i=0;i<res.size();i++){
        res.insert(res.begin()+shift,res[i]);
    }
    return res;
}

}
